message.content:
We “start” with the balance‐sheet “bank deposit” (from the Initial row with type “Bank deposit”) of 5,000,000.00. Then – looking through every transaction – only those that are paid “by Bank Transfer” are assumed to come directly from the bank account, so they reduce its balance. (Sales or payments done “in Cash” or on “Account” do not affect the bank deposit balance.) In our table the only “Bank Transfer”–paid rows are (with their amounts):

• Purchase20231231006: 40,000.00  
• Purchase20231231010: 20,000.00  
• Purchase20231231011: 300,000.00  
• FixedAsset20231231001: 85,889.19  
• Purchase20231231012: 5,000.00  
• Purchase20231231016: 40,000.00  
• Purchase20231231022: 5,000.00  
• Purchase20231231023: 3,000.00  
• Purchase20231231025: 5,000.00  
• Purchase20231231026: 100,000.00  
• Purchase20231231027: 5,000.00  
• Purchase20231231028: 200,000.00  
• Purchase20231231029: 3,000.00

When we add these up the total “bank‐transfer” outflow is:

 40,000 + 20,000 = 60,000  
 60,000 + 300,000 = 360,000  
 360,000 + 85,889.19 = 445,889.19  
 445,889.19 + 5,000 = 450,889.19  
 450,889.19 + 40,000 = 490,889.19  
 490,889.19 + 5,000 = 495,889.19  
 495,889.19 + 3,000 = 498,889.19  
 498,889.19 + 5,000 = 503,889.19  
 503,889.19 + 100,000 = 603,889.19  
 603,889.19 + 5,000 = 608,889.19  
 608,889.19 + 200,000 = 808,889.19  
 808,889.19 + 3,000 = 811,889.19

Thus the bank deposit “uses” (outflows) total 811,889.19.

Subtracting that from the initial bank deposit gives the end‐of–period bank deposits:

 5,000,000.00 – 811,889.19 = 4,188,110.81

So the final answer is:

{
  "solution": {
    "Bank Deposits Initial Value": "5000000.00",
    "Bank Deposits End Value": "4188110.81"
  }
}

That is the bank deposits item in the balance sheet based on the above transactions.
